universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable

Class ProgressDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
      • universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable.ProgressDrawable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircularProgressDrawable, LinearProgressDrawable

    public abstract class ProgressDrawable
extends Drawable
implements Animatable
    This Drawable class represents base implementation for drawables that can draw a progress or an indeterminate graphics. Note, that this drawable class does not draw any progress or indeterminate graphics, such a logic depends on the concrete implementation of the ProgressDrawable like CircularProgressDrawable or LinearProgressDrawable.

    The ProgressDrawable implements base API to support setting of progress value by setProgress(int), supplying color for progress/indeterminate graphics by setColor(int) or setColors(int[]) for multicolored graphics feature which can be enabled setMultiColored(boolean).

    All features related to appearance of the ProgressDrawable like changing its alpha value by setAlpha(int) or tinting of its graphics by setTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) and setTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode) are supported.

    Animating

    The ProgressDrawable also provides base implementation to support running of animations within an implementation of this class. For purpose of this documentation, a time interval between call of start() and call of stop() is called animation session or indeterminate animation session in case of indeterminate mode.

    Tinting

    This drawable provides extended tinting API via following setters:
    • setProgressTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)
    • setProgressTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)
    • setIndeterminateTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)
    • setIndeterminateTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)
    • setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)
    • setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)

    Callbacks

    • ProgressDrawable.AnimationCallback

      This callback can be used to receive callback about started and stopped animation for the ProgressDrawable to which is this callback attached.

    • ProgressDrawable.ExplodeAnimationCallback

      This callback can be used to receive callback about exploded or imploded thickness of the ProgressDrawable to which is this callback attached.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Field Detail

      • DETERMINATE

        public static final int DETERMINATE
        Base flag for DETERMINATE mode.

        This flag is only for internal purpose, use mode flags specified by implementations of this progress drawable instead for convenience.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INDETERMINATE

        public static final int INDETERMINATE
        Base flag for INDETERMINATE mode. In this mode a value of progress is not accepted by progress drawable and call to setProgress(int) is ignored.

        This flag is only for internal purpose, use mode flags specified by implementations of this progress drawable instead for convenience.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_PROGRESS

        public static final int MAX_PROGRESS
        Default maximum value of the progress which can be set to progress drawable.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REQUIRES_SOFTWARE_LAYER

        public static final boolean REQUIRES_SOFTWARE_LAYER
        Boolean flag indicating whether an instance of ProgressDrawable requires the software layer to be used by a view that is hosting such progress drawable so its drawing will work properly.

        Software layer for the view can be requested via View.setLayerType(int, android.graphics.Paint).

      • draw

        public void draw(Canvas canvas)
        Specified by:
        draw in class Drawable

      • onDrawBackground

        protected void onDrawBackground(@NonNull
                                Canvas canvas,
                                @NonNull
                                Paint paint,
                                @Nullable
                                ColorFilter colorFilter)
        Invoked whenever draw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called for this progress drawable and there is background color set and its alpha value is not 0.

        Note, that any color filter set to the given paint will be clear after this call.

        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw background graphics.
        paint - A paint that can be used for drawing operations. This paint has already tint filter specified, based on setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) and setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode) parameters.
        colorFilter - Color filter obtained from the specified paint.

      • onDraw

        protected abstract void onDraw(@NonNull
                               Canvas canvas,
                               @NonNull
                               Paint paint,
                               @Nullable
                               ColorFilter colorFilter)
        Invoked whenever draw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called for this progress drawable and the current alpha value of the current color is not 0.

        Note, that any color filter set to the given paint will be clear after this call.

        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas on which to draw progress or indeterminate graphics.
        paint - A paint that can be used for drawing operations.
        colorFilter - Color filter obtained from the specified paint.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts a new animation session of this progress drawable. The new session is started only if this drawable does not have animation session running at this time and its current mode is not DETERMINATE.

        Do not forget to stop the animation session by stop() or stopImmediate() whenever this drawable is no longer visible or drawn.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Animatable

      • stopImmediate

        public void stopImmediate()
        Stops the current animation session of this progress drawable. The sessions is stopped only if this drawable does have animation session running at this time and its current mode is not DETERMINATE.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Like stopImmediate(), but this will stop the current animation session after drawing of the currently visible indeterminate graphics is finished, so it will not look like the current graphics just "vanished".
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Animatable

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns a flag indicating whether this drawable does have animation sessions currently running or not.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Animatable
        Returns:
        True if animation session is running, false otherwise.

      • explode

        public void explode()
        Animates thickness of this progress drawable from 0 to value specified by setThickness(float).

        Does nothing if thickness of this drawable is already exploded.

        Note, that this will not affect in any way currently running animation session started by start().

        See Also:
        implode(), isExploded()

      • implode

        public void implode()
        Animates thickness of this progress drawable from value specified by setThickness(float) to 0.

        Does nothing if thickness of this drawable is already imploded.

        Note, that this will not affect in any way currently running animation session started by start().

        See Also:
        explode(), isExploded()

      • setExploded

        public void setExploded(boolean exploded)
        Sets a flag indicating whether thickness of this progress drawable is exploded or imploded. This will also update thickness of this drawable.
        Parameters:
        exploded - True to set thickness to value specified by setThickness(float) false to 0 so this drawable will be invisible.
        See Also:
        isExploded()

      • isExploded

        public boolean isExploded()
        Returns a flag indicating whether thickness of this progress drawable is exploded or imploded.

        Note, that if progress drawable is imploded, it means its current thickness is at 0, so it is not being drawn.

        Returns:
        True if thickness is value specified by setThickness(float), false otherwise.

      • setExplodeDuration

        public void setExplodeDuration(long duration)
        Sets the duration for explode/implode animation of this progress drawable.
        Parameters:
        duration - The desired duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getExplodeDuration(), explode(), implode()

      • getExplodeDuration

        public long getExplodeDuration()
        Returns the duration used for explode/implode animation.
        Returns:
        Animation duration in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setExplodeDuration(long), explode(), implode()

      • setProgress

        public boolean setProgress(int progress)
        Sets the current progress value of this progress drawable which determines size of progress drawn by this drawable.

        Does nothing if the current mode is INDETERMINATE.

        Parameters:
        progress - The desired progress. Should be from the range [0, getMax()].
        Returns:
        True if progress has been changed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getProgress()

      • onProgressChange

        protected boolean onProgressChange(int progress)
        Invoked whenever setProgress(int) is called and the current progress has been changed.

        This implementation does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        progress - The currently changed progress.
        Returns:
        True if this drawable should be invalidated due to this change, false otherwise.

      • getProgress

        public int getProgress()
        Returns the progress value set to this progress drawable by setProgress(int).
        Returns:
        Current progress or 0 if the current mode is not DETERMINATE.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Changes mode of this progress drawable. The progress mode specifies behaviour and drawing of this drawable and its progress.

        Note, that changing the current mode will not affect in any way currently running animation session, just drawing behaviour of the progress/indeterminate graphics. This means, that changing mode to for example INDETERMINATE will not start indeterminate animation session by start(), this is responsibility of the user (view) of this drawable to start or stop animations properly. This is due to performance, so changing mode will not start animations at time when the view which hosts this drawable is not attached to window yet.

        Parameters:
        mode - A flag of the desired mode.
        See Also:
        getMode()

      • onPreModeChange

        protected void onPreModeChange(int mode)
        Invoked whenever setMode(int) is called and the current mode should be changed.

        This implementation does nothing.

        Parameters:
        mode - The mode which will be changed after this call.

      • onModeChange

        protected boolean onModeChange(int mode)
        Invoked whenever setMode(int) is called and the current mode has been changed.

        This implementation does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        mode - The currently changed mode.
        Returns:
        True if this drawable should be invalidated due to this change, false otherwise.

      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        Returns the current mode of this progress drawable set by setMode(int).
        Returns:
        Current mode.
        See Also:
        setMode(int)

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Sets the color used to draw graphics of this progress drawable.

        Note, that this color is used only if the multicolored mode is disabled. See setMultiColored(boolean) for more info.

        Parameters:
        color - The desired color.
        See Also:
        getColor()

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the color used to draw graphics of this progress drawable.
        Returns:
        The current color. This color can be modified whenever setAlpha(int) is called.
        See Also:
        setColor(int)

      • setColors

        public void setColors(@Nullable
                      int[] colors)
        Sets the set of colors used to draw graphics of this progress drawable. The given colors are used only if the mode of this drawable is INDETERMINATE and the multicolored mode is enabled by setMultiColored(boolean).

        How a specific color is picked from the given set depends on a specific implementation of this progress drawable, but basically the current color is changed whenever this drawable enters a next indeterminate "session".

        Parameters:
        colors - The desired set of colors. May be null but not empty.
        See Also:
        getColors()

      • getColors

        public int[] getColors()
        Returns the set of colors used to draw graphics of this progress drawable in the INDETERMINATE mode.
        Returns:
        Set of colors or null if no colors were specified.
        See Also:
        setColors(int[])

      • setMultiColored

        public void setMultiColored(boolean multiColored)
        Sets a flag indicating whether this progress drawable should use set of colors specified by setColors(int[]) to draw its graphics whenever in the INDETERMINATE mode.
        Parameters:
        multiColored - True to use set of colors, false to use color specified by setColor(int).
        See Also:
        isMultiColored()

      • isMultiColored

        public boolean isMultiColored()
        Returns a flag indicating whether this progress drawable uses set of colors or single color to draw its graphics.
        Returns:
        True if this drawable is multicolored, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setMultiColored(boolean)

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • setThickness

        public void setThickness(float thickness)
        Sets the thickness of this progress drawable. The specified thickness can be animated by explode() or implode().

        How the thickness is used when drawing this drawable depends on a specific implementation of this drawable.

        Parameters:
        thickness - The desired thickness in pixels.
        See Also:
        getThickness()

      • onThicknessChange

        protected boolean onThicknessChange(float thickness)
        Invoked whenever setThickness(float) is called and the current thickness has been changed. This will be also invoked during running explode or implode animation.

        This implementation does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        thickness - The currently changed thickness.
        Returns:
        True if this drawable should be invalidated due to this change, false otherwise.

      • getThickness

        Returns:

        See Also:

        public void setRounded(boolean rounded)

        Parameters:

        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setIndeterminateInterpolator

        public void setIndeterminateInterpolator(@NonNull
                                         Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets the interpolator used to interpolate computed update values for indeterminate blocks whenever animation session for none DETERMINATE mode is running.

        Default interpolator is AccelerateDecelerateInterpolator.

        Parameters:
        interpolator - The desired interpolator.
        See Also:
        getIndeterminateInterpolator()

      • getIndeterminateInterpolator

        @NonNull
public Interpolator getIndeterminateInterpolator()
        Returns the interpolator used whenever the current mode is none DETERMINATE to interpolate update values for indeterminate blocks.
        Returns:
        Indeterminate interpolator.
        See Also:
        setIndeterminateInterpolator(android.view.animation.Interpolator)

      • setIndeterminateSpeed

        public void setIndeterminateSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the speed for indeterminate blocks update used whenever the current mode is none DETERMINATE.

        Default speed is 1f. This speed should be changed only with a good reason to.

        Parameters:
        speed - The desired speed. Should be from the range [0, infinite).
        See Also:
        getIndeterminateSpeed()

      • getIndeterminateSpeed

        public float getIndeterminateSpeed()
        Returns the current speed to speed up indeterminate blocks update.
        Returns:
        Current indeterminate speed.
        See Also:
        setIndeterminateSpeed(float)

      • setAlpha

        Sets the progress color's alpha value.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        alpha - The desired alpha value to set. Should be from the range [0, 255].

      • setBackgroundTintList

        public void setBackgroundTintList(@Nullable
                                  ColorStateList tint)
        Sets a tint for the background graphics of this drawable.

        Setting a color filter via setColorFilter(android.graphics.ColorFilter) will override the tint.

        Parameters:
        tint - Color state list to use for tinting of the background graphics. May be null to clear the current background tint.

      • setBackgroundTintMode

        public void setBackgroundTintMode(@Nullable
                                  PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
        Sets a tint blending mode for the background graphics of this drawable.

        Setting a color filter via setColorFilter(android.graphics.ColorFilter) will override the tint.

        Parameters:
        tintMode - The desired Porter-Duff blending mode.

      • setProgressTintList

                                 ProgressDrawable.AnimationCallback callback)

        Parameters:

                                        ProgressDrawable.ExplodeAnimationCallback callback)

      • onStateChange

        protected boolean onStateChange(int[] state)
        Overrides:
        onStateChange in class Drawable

      • onBoundsChange

        protected void onBoundsChange(Rect bounds)
        Overrides:
        onBoundsChange in class Drawable

      • onExplodedChange

        protected boolean onExplodedChange(boolean exploded)
        Invoked whenever setExploded(boolean) is called and the current boolean flag for exploded state has been changed.

        This implementation does nothing and returns false.

        Parameters:
        exploded - The current boolean flag for exploded state.
        Returns:
        True if this drawable should be invalidated due to this change, false otherwise.

      • onStart

        protected abstract void onStart()
        Invoked whenever start() is called and this progress drawable does not have animation session currently running and the current mode is none DETERMINATE.

      • onStop

        protected abstract void onStop()
        Invoked whenever stop() is called and this progress drawable does have animation sessions currently running and the current mode is none DETERMINATE.

      • onStopImmediate

        protected abstract void onStopImmediate()
        Invoked whenever stopImmediate() is called and this progress drawable does have animation sessions currently running and the current mode is none DETERMINATE.

      • onExplode

        protected void onExplode()
        Invoked whenever explode() is called and thickness of this progress drawable is not exploded yet.

        This implementation will schedule updates to increase the current thickness to the value specified by setThickness(float).

      • onImplode

        protected void onImplode()
        Invoked whenever implode() is called and thickness of this progress drawable is not imploded yet.

        This implementation will schedule updates to decrease the current thickness to 0.
